title: It s Amazingly Cheap Acquire Fleet Airbus Jets
text: Just seemed Dubai Air Show would embarrassment Airbus SE  top salesman John Leahy rustles  50 billion order  But here s question  How four airlines  one started flying year combined yearly sales less  5 billion  pay hundreds planes priced 10 times that  The answer  They probably won t buy them  they ll rent them  That tells something easy money transforming industry  Bill Franke  managing partner private equity fund Indigo Partners LLC  interests U S  budget operator Frontier Airlines Inc  Volaris  Mexico  east Europe focused Wizz Air Holdings Plc Chile s JetSmart case point  Perhaps negotiating behalf four airlines  unconnected besides Indigo s investments  got better deal they d got alone  Still  even ignore  50 billion sticker price  airlines typically pay half catalog price  lot money  Warren Buffett described airlines investor deathtrap  what s attraction private equity  Wizz  Volaris Frontier certainly look like decent businesses judged last year s earnings  although Volaris slipped bit late  It s early tell JetSmart began operating summer  Franke s airlines generally fast growing profitable  part low expenses using latest fuel efficient jets  All three exclusively adopted A320 jet family cost reasons too  makes easy swap flight crews maintenance less complicated  But there s more  In industry relies expensive planes  Franke s airline holdings remarkably asset light  helps explain appeal  Instead buying jets outright  Frontier  Wizz Volaris use sale and leasebacks  This makes financial sense  One industry observer says cost lease finance might half funding aircraft equity flood cheap capital  much Chinese  By avoiding ownership  airlines also sidestep residual value risk  If plane s value falls  that s leasing company s problem  Franke s  True  order jets make pre delivery payment  PDP  typically 5 per cent purchase price  sometimes more  But there s financing too  A Frontier subsidiary  150 million PDP loan facility Citibank  according IPO prospectus  So even newbie like JetSmart order scores planes without spending much cash  What s catch  For one thing  companies  balance sheets going look less pretty new accounting rules called IFRS 16 arrive 2019  As Gadfly explained here  rules force companies include operating lease commitments reported debt asset calculations  All three airlines acknowledge  significant impact  accounts  In addition  airlines still need clear idea they re going new planes  Norwegian Air Shuttle ASA  another low cost airline famous massive jet order  isn t exactly reassuring  The stock fallen one third year amid investor worries cost breakneck expansion rising competition  One could argue Norwegian ordered many aircraft  But despite burning heaps cash  managed finance find use them  As didn t enough plate  Norwegian setting budget airline Argentina  There many daunting things creating running airline  finding money expand isn t one them  This column necessarily reflect opinion Bloomberg LP owners

title: The FCC Vote That Puts Local News Risk
text: The Federal Communications Commission vote week whether eliminate variety limitations media ownership  Some rollbacks overdue  But others overdone   threaten diminish variety news views broadcast local television  The key telling difference keep mind FCC s main purpose kind regulation  promote competition diversity views local markets  Before purging antiquated rulebook  commission develop new framework advancing broader goals  An example outdated regulation one prohibiting companies owning television station newspaper radio station market  The rule may made sense 1970s  dominant forces local media markets print radio  But media faded influence informed citizens increasingly turn cable TV internet range news opinion unimaginable four decades ago  What s more  makes little sense distinguish physical newspaper digital one  If television stations latter  permitted former   vice versa  Repealing rule could help save newspapers radio stations struggling financially  though could also lead consolidation industries   trend likely continue matter FCC does  None say FCC simply give goal fostering competition   economic otherwise  This especially true regulating airwaves  public resource  Yet FCC wants jettison rules prohibit companies owning two television stations markets aren t least eight independent stations  wants weaken rules prohibit one company owning two top rated stations  Chairman Ajit Pai argues limitations longer serve public interest  given proliferation news sources internet cable television  But Americans afford  access to  internet cable   little local news cable channels  Moreover  law  broadcast license comes responsibilities serve needs interests local communities  If one company multiple stations market  diversity local perspectives programming could diminished  In cable news  channels tilt coverage one direction offset tilt opposite way  Media companies long engaged type activity  one extent another  The best way counter it  locally nationally  ensure diversity voices  Rolling back ownership rules public airwaves make difficult  The media landscape shifted dramatically since 1970s  FCC s rules kept pace  By means  update new century  But dumping old rules protect kind robust diverse media industry democracy requires   Editors  Francis Barry  Michael Newman  To contact senior editor responsible Bloomberg View s editorials  David Shipley davidshipley bloomberg net

title: Amazon s Cashierless Store Is Almost Ready Prime Time
text: For past year  Amazon employees test driving Amazon Go  experimental convenience store downtown Seattle  The idea let consumers walk in  pick items pay without ever standing line cashier  Amazon vague mechanics  store relies mobile app sensing technology powers self driving cars figure buying what  Employees tried fool technology  One day  three enterprising Amazonians donned bright yellow Pikachu costumes cruised around grabbing sandwiches  drinks snacks  The algorithms nailed it  according person familiar situation  correctly identifying employees charging Amazon accounts  even though obscured behind yellow polyester  The Amazon Go grocery store Seattle  Photographer  David Ryder Bloomberg Amazon Go represents Amazon com Inc s ambitious effort yet transform brick and mortar shopping experience eliminating checkout line  saving customers time furthering company s reputation convenience  The push groceries way company get consumers shop Amazon often  In September  e commerce giant acquired Whole Foods Market  13 7 billion cutting prices upscale grocery chain drive traffic  On Wednesday  Whole Foods began offering deep discounts Thanksgiving merchandise  including antibiotic free turkeys  signaled markdowns get aggressive adopts Amazon s Prime subscription service  Shares Kroger Sprouts tumbled announcement  Amazon unveiled Amazon Go last December  saying planned open store public early year  However  company encountered technical difficulties postponed launch work bugs  The Wall Street Journal reported March  Seven months later  challenges remain   just walk out  technology improved markedly  says person  requested anonymity speak freely project  And sign concept almost ready prime time  hiring Amazon Go team shifted engineers research scientists needed perfect platform construction managers marketers would build promote stores consumers  Amazon declined comment  Shoppers visiting Amazon Go store scan smartphones upon entering  Cameras shelf sensors work together figure items removed removed them  person says  need tracking devices  radio frequency chips  embedded merchandise  When shoppers leave  algorithms total order bill Amazon account  The system working well individual shoppers still struggles accurately charge people moving around groups  families grabby kids  person says  Go engineers studying families shopping together tweaking sensors recognize child eats item wandering around store  Engineers also figuring person charge couple goes shopping together  Amazon encouraged employees enter store pairs buy lunch  The company conducting tests focus groups undisclosed building Seattle  person said  The focus groups used design protocols in store returns  spoiled damaged merchandise customer service issues common brick and mortar retail  It s unclear quickly Amazon Go ramp up  The company moved deliberately brick and mortar book stores  opening 13 seven states since launching first one Seattle two years ago  Analysts expect version Amazon Go technology rolled eventually Whole Foods  That s far challenging prospect Whole Foods locations much larger 1 800 square foot convenience store carry thousands products  Amazon  says currently plans  would need lot testers wearing Pikachu costumes pull off  For Amazon  check Decrypted podcast

title: California s Housing Policy Is Holding Back Its Climate Policy
text: The high cost housing California isn t hurting state s economy  fueling homelessness  exacerbating economic inequality  It s imperiling reputation global leader emissions reductions  too  Lila Cabrera s move last year Palmdale  city 160 000 high desert region Antelope Valley north Los Angeles  illustrates connection  As renter Sylmar  Calif   I overdrawn every month  says single mom three   I couldn t see turning around  Now   1 370 mortgage payment gets family space less money  It also gets 51 mile commute  which  typical bumper to bumper traffic  takes average two hours way  As residents like Cabrera move farther employment search affordable homes  state s progress toward climate goals slowing  In 2015  recent year data available  state s greenhouse gas emissions dropped less half rate previous year  according August report San Francisco based nonprofit Next 10  Low gas prices lack affordable housing prompted driving contributed 3 1 percent increase exhaust cars  buses  trucks  report says  Census data show 635 000 California workers commutes 90 minutes 2015  40 percent jump 2010   California failed build  housing  communities we re seeing largest job growth  says Patrick Kallerman  research director Bay Area Council Economic Institute  nonpartisan think tank based San Francisco   The highest income folks afford live wherever want  says   It s middle  lower income folks can t  The state needs 180 000 new housing units year  fewer 100 000 built  according Governor Jerry Brown s office   Each year goes on  things get worse  Kallerman says  Lack accountability one reason  California tasks regional agencies developing sustainable community planning strategies  include reducing sprawl  But communities fail meet goals  mechanisms penalize them  says  One disincentive builders fiscalization land use  Housing raises less tax revenue local governments retail  For Cabrera  incentives even twisted  She works mortgage loan processor bank near Hollywood  Her  72 000 yearly salary heavily dependent commissions  determined real estate prices  Were swap job one Palmdale  she d earn less money revert living paycheck paycheck  So goes many Californians  When cost living accounted for  census data show state nation s highest poverty rate  20 6 percent  Brown embraced role counterweight do nothing climate deniers Washington  recently United Nations Climate Change Conference Bonn  Germany  A Democrat fourth final term office  he s championed passage strictest emissions laws state  But residents  continued reliance cars getting way  Transportation accounts almost 40 percent greenhouse gas emissions California  sector  compared 27 percent nationwide  The state legislature made housing crisis focus year s session  passing 15 related bills  One seeks expedite construction accelerating approval process affordable housing  Another could raise much  250 million annually subsidized housing enough build 750 homes  given  332 000 per unit estimate Brown s office  Another places referendum next year s ballot asking voters approve  4 billion low income housing home loans veterans   They re good  move ball forward  Brown said signing measures law October   Have ended need legislation  Unfortunately not

text: President Donald Trump pushed back Wednesday observations nearly two week trip Asia produced breakthroughs trade North Korea  delivering 24 minute statement White House defense nationalist aggression  The U S  trade deficit  put  800 billion year   unacceptable  We going start whittling down  fast possible  While abroad  11 Pacific Rim nations announced would revive Trans Pacific Partnership Trump scrapped upon entering office  time without U S  participant  The Trump administration also embroiled testy negotiations Mexico Canada revisions North American Free Trade Agreement  pact president also threatened abandon  Trump said Wednesday countries participating three summits attended trip agreed support U S  campaign economically pressure North Korea abandoning nuclear program  The country s regime remains defiant  however  official statements following Trump s visit China White House Beijing   North Korea s important economic partner ally   didn t indicate specific progress  Chinese President Xi Jinping dispatching envoy North Korea week  according official Xinhua News Agency  supposedly brief country s leadership China s once in five year leadership shuffle  The timing suggests envoy may carry message talks Trump Xi    With assistance Justin Sink

title: It s Amazingly Cheap Acquire Fleet Airbus Jets
text: Just seemed Dubai Air Show would embarrassment Airbus SE  top salesman John Leahy rustles  50 billion order  But here s question  How four airlines  one started flying year combined yearly sales less  5 billion  pay hundreds planes priced 10 times that  The answer  They probably won t buy them  they ll rent them  That tells something easy money transforming industry  Bill Franke  managing partner private equity fund Indigo Partners LLC  interests U S  budget operator Frontier Airlines Inc  Volaris  Mexico  east Europe focused Wizz Air Holdings Plc Chile s JetSmart case point  Perhaps negotiating behalf four airlines  unconnected besides Indigo s investments  got better deal they d got alone  Still  even ignore  50 billion sticker price  airlines typically pay half catalog price  lot money  Warren Buffett described airlines investor deathtrap  what s attraction private equity  Wizz  Volaris Frontier certainly look like decent businesses judged last year s earnings  although Volaris slipped bit late  It s early tell JetSmart began operating summer  Franke s airlines generally fast growing profitable  part low expenses using latest fuel efficient jets  All three exclusively adopted A320 jet family cost reasons too  makes easy swap flight crews maintenance less complicated  But there s more  In industry relies expensive planes  Franke s airline holdings remarkably asset light  helps explain appeal  Instead buying jets outright  Frontier  Wizz Volaris use sale and leasebacks  This makes financial sense  One industry observer says cost lease finance might half funding aircraft equity flood cheap capital  much Chinese  By avoiding ownership  airlines also sidestep residual value risk  If plane s value falls  that s leasing company s problem  Franke s  True  order jets make pre delivery payment  PDP  typically 5 per cent purchase price  sometimes more  But there s financing too  A Frontier subsidiary  150 million PDP loan facility Citibank  according IPO prospectus  So even newbie like JetSmart order scores planes without spending much cash  What s catch  For one thing  companies  balance sheets going look less pretty new accounting rules called IFRS 16 arrive 2019  As Gadfly explained here  rules force companies include operating lease commitments reported debt asset calculations  All three airlines acknowledge  significant impact  accounts  In addition  airlines still need clear idea they re going new planes  Norwegian Air Shuttle ASA  another low cost airline famous massive jet order  isn t exactly reassuring  The stock fallen one third year amid investor worries cost breakneck expansion rising competition  One could argue Norwegian ordered many aircraft  But despite burning heaps cash  managed finance find use them  As didn t enough plate  Norwegian setting budget airline Argentina  There many daunting things creating running airline  finding money expand isn t one them  This column necessarily reflect opinion Bloomberg LP owners

title: The FCC Vote That Puts Local News Risk
text: The Federal Communications Commission vote week whether eliminate variety limitations media ownership  Some rollbacks overdue  But others overdone   threaten diminish variety news views broadcast local television  The key telling difference keep mind FCC s main purpose kind regulation  promote competition diversity views local markets  Before purging antiquated rulebook  commission develop new framework advancing broader goals  An example outdated regulation one prohibiting companies owning television station newspaper radio station market  The rule may made sense 1970s  dominant forces local media markets print radio  But media faded influence informed citizens increasingly turn cable TV internet range news opinion unimaginable four decades ago  What s more  makes little sense distinguish physical newspaper digital one  If television stations latter  permitted former   vice versa  Repealing rule could help save newspapers radio stations struggling financially  though could also lead consolidation industries   trend likely continue matter FCC does  None say FCC simply give goal fostering competition   economic otherwise  This especially true regulating airwaves  public resource  Yet FCC wants jettison rules prohibit companies owning two television stations markets aren t least eight independent stations  wants weaken rules prohibit one company owning two top rated stations  Chairman Ajit Pai argues limitations longer serve public interest  given proliferation news sources internet cable television  But Americans afford  access to  internet cable   little local news cable channels  Moreover  law  broadcast license comes responsibilities serve needs interests local communities  If one company multiple stations market  diversity local perspectives programming could diminished  In cable news  channels tilt coverage one direction offset tilt opposite way  Media companies long engaged type activity  one extent another  The best way counter it  locally nationally  ensure diversity voices  Rolling back ownership rules public airwaves make difficult  The media landscape shifted dramatically since 1970s  FCC s rules kept pace  By means  update new century  But dumping old rules protect kind robust diverse media industry democracy requires   Editors  Francis Barry  Michael Newman  To contact senior editor responsible Bloomberg View s editorials  David Shipley davidshipley bloomberg net

title: Snapchat Has Child Porn Problem
text: Last year 13 year old Illinois boy learned old  painful lesson online relationships  After swapping messages someone claimed 19 year old woman search nude photos  eventually sent indecent video title: The Death First Class
text: At beginning November  Singapore Airlines Ltd  announced world s luxurious  fully enclosed first class seat  Passengers expect best  bedding  for two  desired  embroidered Lalique  dinner served financial equation  By mid 1980s  caught brutal price wars  U S  carriers struggling keep offering first class levels service reduced prices  One solution  Leave first class seats empty give away free upgrades valued customers  As recently 2011  14 percent Delta Air Lines Inc s first class seats paid for  rest flew empty upgraded passengers  From business standpoint  that s terribly good use plane s valuable real estate  The solution  devised mid 1970s  business class  As first deployed  offered full fare paying customers slightly higher level service discounted tickets  Eventually  business class grew luxurious  began cannibalize first class  That s going continue  For lower still expensive fares  business travelers enjoy amenities would ve considered first class years ago  including lie flat beds  better food   increasingly   door privacy  More important  it s possible stuff business class seats first class seats amount space  making business class winner airlines  too  Despite hype around new first class suite  even Singapore Airlines reducing number suites fleet 50 percent  boosting number business class seats 10 percent   11 planes   30 percent  Likewise  even Emirates touts hyper luxury suites  plans offer six barely nine planes end 2019   less 4 percent fleet  For better idea Emirates sees future  look record setting 615 seat plane started flying 2015  Those planes won t offer first class all  Among big three U S  carriers  Delta phased international first class altogether  United ending 2018 American offers small handful flights  Elsewhere world  airlines including Cathay Pacific  Lufthansa  Air India  Qantas reducing number first class seats routes they re available  As global aviation becomes competitive  greater numbers passengers developing regions take first flights  pressure keep prices increase  Celebrities recluses willing fork thousands dollars private suite probably always first class option flights global financial centers  But people likely content business class   money private jet  Airlines use first class suites largely marketing opportunities buff brand  even pack seats planes  For world  class matter future cattle class  This column About 800 endowments together hold  500 billion  led Harvard  37 1 billion  Thanks strong market  many schools richer ever  don t pay taxes investment earnings  Their funds become major players title: In search Russia s lost gold
text: It third night Trans Siberian Express mid July  grown accustomed heat  The prehistoric cars contained neither air conditioning showers  My husband Dennis  doesn t speak Russian  left play new fancy video camera  I fortunate   I could listen conversations  As I stood narrow hallway train  waiting turn use bathroom  two middle aged Russian guys front queue heated debate infamous treasure train rattled along tracks century ago  possibly setting course Russian Revolution   The gold s buried woods right there  said one them  jabbing finger vast Siberian plains flying outside window   The guards stole bunch en route   No  gold fell  Lake  Baikal  That s no one find trace it  You may also interested in    The town gave Russia name   The lost jewels Bad King John   Why Genghis Khan s couldn t help interrupt   Don t historians agree gold found accounted for  I asked   I read Sergey Volkov s book  The Ghost Kolchak s Gold Train  The man head line laughed   Yeah  right  We always believe read book  The bathroom door opened elderly lady squeezed past us  The man stepped in  shut door  stuck head informed condescendingly   Anyone write anything book  If want know real story  listen people  My family moved New York City Russia nearly 30 years ago  I m still weirdly drawn country s old sagas   tsar s lost gold one enticing  Before World War I  Russia possessed third largest gold reserve world  bested US France  When war broke out  tsar s supporters  White Forces  moved nearly 500 tons gold capital St Petersburg  felt close Russia s western border gold s safekeeping  Kazan   hometown   big trading city Trans Siberian Railroad  640km east Moscow  The Bolsheviks  Red Army  led Vladimir Lenin commander Leon Trotsky  laid siege Kazan seize treasure tsar s troops  Whoever got gold would enough money pay arms soldiers  would win revolution  Whoever got gold would win revolution In summer 1918  bitter fight White Forces  Trotsky Bolsheviks took Kazan  But Red Army soldiers triumphantly marched steps Kazan Bank  found vaults empty  The treasure already way Siberia  yet control revolutionary regime  Trotsky assembled train gave chase  Having done nightly ablutions rattling sink train s closet like bathroom  I lied berth  leafing book Volkov  lifelong Russian historian expertise Siberia Baikal  published 2011  picturing two armoured trains chugging woods Trans Siberian Express  It would take three days reach Siberia Kazan  century ago journey would taken months  The trains  powered hand loaded coal furnaces  moved slowly  And importantly  hobbled intermittent battles  fuel shortages  harsh winter weather general chaos war  neither White Forces Bolsheviks could advance quickly  The chase  like schlepp obstacles  progressed slow motion  A months race  halfway across Siberia  treasure train arrived hands general Alexander Kolchak  White Forces  newly minted commander in chief  With Trotsky s troops tail  Kolchak directed train east  far away enemy possible  He brought train Irkutsk  trading city near Lake Baikal  And that s exactly train stopping next  We arrived Irkutsk dead night  city empty even taxi drivers gone  With vague sense hotel was  Dennis I dragged luggage darkened streets  avoiding stray dogs made home overgrown bushes  Streetlights didn t seem work part town  spent hour walking circles moon light  We could barely believe luck finally discovered hotel behind patch tall trees  It Irkutsk Czech battalions  hired Russia fight alongside World War I  stranded Bolsheviks seized Russia s western part cut routes Europe  The Czechs wanted go home  treasure train arrived Irkutsk  captured Kolchak gold handed Bolsheviks exchange permission set sail Vladivostok port Russia s far east  The infrastructure eastern Russia hadn t yet ravaged war revolution  Czechs  heading east safer taking direct route west  The collateral worked  The Bolsheviks took gold  let Czechs begin journey promptly shot Kolchak  next 70 years portrayed Soviet history books enemy people thus deserving death firing squad  But Dennis I wandered along Irkutsk s broad streets next day  I made surprising discovery  In one city squares I found recently erected monument Kolchak  honouring important political figure  Russian historians clearly rewritten chapter revolutionary chronicle  monument s brass plaque explained fought ideals died protecting empire s treasure  Kolchak s story culminated Irkutsk  treasure s journey didn t  The Bolsheviks loaded gold onto new train sent back Kazan  According Volkov  treasure returned entirety  But historians insist numbers don t add up  easily 200 tons  more  Local lore sides latter  tremendous fortunes fingertips  would hungry  angry  war ravaged Czech soldiers really hand Red title: Civil asset forfeiture policing USA
text: Attorney General Jeff Sessions business reviving bounty hunting program  Our view Attorney General Jeff Sessions  Photo  Andrew Harnik  AP  In America you re innocent proven guilty  Constitution provides protections   instance  right lawyer speedy trial   ensure can t unfairly punished  But forget state local police  suspect  cash  car even home might somehow involved crime  In case  grab loot keep benefit departments without going court  You try get property back  burden victim seizure prove money derived crime  This federal program curtailed 2015 Obama administration  But Attorney General Jeff Sessions reviving it  He calls  key tool helps law enforcement defund organized crime  take back ill gotten gains   weakens criminals cartels  Not fast  Mr  Attorney General  OPPOSING VIEW  Don t abolish asset forfeiture Civil asset forfeiture  expanded 1970s tool war drugs  become unmoored original intent take profit crime  Local police  sharing program Justice Department  often use ordinary citizens happen carrying cash police find suspicious  Its victims   many never charged  let alone convicted crime   included hapless drivers carrying cash renovate house  buy used car pay dental work  Police often grab cars  too  leaving stranded  Ming Tong Liu  Chinese born American  driving Louisiana buy restaurant stopped ticketed speeding Alabama  When police found  75 195 cash car  brought drug sniffing dog   alerted  cash  Though drugs found charges filed  police seized money  It took Liu 10 months  two lawyers two claims get back family s savings  By then  restaurant deal fallen through  Many people wherewithal fight back retaining attorney specializing complex issue going court  Or amounts small  victims simply let money go  But money adds up  From 2000 2013  state local police took  4 7 billion Justice Department s federal state civil asset forfeiture programs  Fourteen states recognized unfairness require criminal conviction someone s assets taken  be  Several states placed limits seizures  But Sessions  restart sharing program would allow police states tough laws get around working feds  Supporters program point  safeguards  Sessions added  The problem is  new directives can t fix program core turns justice system upside down  Ending program dewy eyed liberal cause  The ACLU  libertarian Institute Justice  Koch brothers groups parts ideological spectrum called Congress last month roll back reform civil asset forfeiture  In March  conservative Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas wrote system  has led egregious well chronicled abuses  adding seizures  frequently target poor groups least able defend interests  Legally seizing assets evidence arrest retaining legal process conviction fully justified  vague suspicion  The nation s top law enforcement officer business championing program allows police victimize helpless citizens benefit agencies  That s law enforcement  It s bounty hunting  The program  virtually killed 2015  remain buried  USA title: I m Black Veteran  Why Is Trump Making Me Feel Unpatriotic
text: Is thing black American  This really easy question United States yet answer correctly  And it s reason I worried future country  Story Continued Below That last statement feel cliche given current environment  partisans spin routine conflicts existential threats describe every election final verdict nation s fate  But something different happening politics today  There seems subtle incredible patriots  As black man Northern Virginia  I well aware state s gubernatorial race seen bellwether white identity politics electoral expediency racial animus  For weeks  bombarded Republican nominee Ed Gillespie s campaign ads dog whistled soundtracks preservation Confederate statues taking stands Election Day tower lot heathens who d dare take knee national anthem  So view Democrat Ralph congresswoman Florida  chastised president making insensitive comments Myeshia Johnson  widow U S  Army Sgt  La David Johnson killed Niger  White House chief staff John Kelly called  empty barrel  others labeled national disgrace  The White House contrasted Kelly Wilson  saying  highly inappropriate  question four star general  thank God patriots like Gen  Kelly  The list goes on  Black Lives Matter characterized  un American  Trump emissary former New York Mayor Rudy Guiliani  During Attorney General Jeff Sessions  confirmation hearing  witnesses testified he d called NAACP un American segregated communities socioeconomic disparities   black African gun crime black Africans  conveniently leaving  American  And  course  things compare Trump s insistence nation s first black president was  fact  American all  And quite pleased Arizona s embattled former Sheriff Joe Arpaio volunteered look Barack Obama s birth certificate  Trump recently pardoned Arpaio criminal contempt conviction racial profiling case  calling  great American patriot  In previous life military officer  job preoccupied threats America s well being  And precisely reason current political rhetoric around race patriotism feels especially acute inappropriate  This tactic the attempt disentangle blackness patriotism America is extremely dangerous  It born ugliest parts history presents dire threat political stability  Let us never forget thing ever broken Union half question I began with  Should thing black American  We went war question  More 600 000 countrymen died question  A president assassinated question  The notion black American controversial Founding Fathers avoided altogether  Citizens turned guns other  Racist state regimes violently suppressed constitutional rights  And Army s elite 101st Airborne Division deployed nine black teenagers could go high school Little Rock  Arkansas  So patriotism black Americans questioned even it s done simply reframe debate favorable terms avoid uncomfortable conversations race the nation s worst impulses resurface  It fosters perception black people United States less American white neighbors  Being seen less American means one less claim citizenship  civil protections equal opportunity  It s creates voting laws complicate voting process black communities instead making easier  It s rationale aggressive policing minority communities  It s core view black achievement United States isn t product intellect hard work  white magnanimity  And veteran  I take deep offense attempt separate blackness America patriotism  Black people United States fought every war since nation s inception even could access citizenship  Black troops left families  took arms foreign shores  risked lives idea  promise  They fought Revolutionary War American independence  War 1812 American self determination Spanish American War 1898 American expansion all hopes service would compel nation recognize rights full citizenship  What higher form American patriotism fighting inalienable rights life  liberty pursuit happiness can t access it  That Spirit  76 led nation s creation  And  necessity  spirit still much alive well black America yet realize fullness American promise  These signs lesser Americans  signature superlative citizens  And yet  despite fighting unrealized freedoms  scores black veterans returning home conflict denied access veterans benefits rights full American citizenship  Jehu Grant enslaved man Rhode Island fought Continental Army  But Congress passed Pension Act 1832  Grant s annuity denied America determined slaves couldn t soldiers  When black World War II vets returned home  nearly denied access GI Bill  helped white veterans buy homes get education helped create atrocious racial wealth gap today  This happens black people even willing put lives line aren t seen real Americans  This this inability allow black Americans fully black fully American is national weakness  And enemies know it  The recent revelations Russia took fake ads Facebook used fake Twitter accounts exacerbate racial tensions United States come surprise  The fact countries long sought exploit racial discrimination order weaken United States shocking  Racism fault line  Achilles  heel  So tactic labeling black citizens critical government leaders un American dangerous ground  It playing fire that s consumed us past one domestic threat dismantle us again  I worried country  Not myopic lazy politicians decide play people s fears prejudices win elections  Not white nationalists march across university campuses discount Tiki torches  Not polarized politics side sees evil destructive  I worried country yet decided whether black American paradox fellow citizen  We cannot both  history proved country cannot survive former  Either United States preserved made perfect believe world s largest multiracial democratic republic bound together notion equal access founding ideals  squander opportunity republic slip grasp title: Warming climate prompts Europe think outside box
text: Illustrations David Doran POLITICO COP23 Warming climate prompts Europe think outside box From snowless ski slopes green roofs handling forest fires  Continent adapting new reality  Climate slopes becoming growing worry Alpine glaciers retreat annual snowfalls shrivel   shrinking length season making lower mountain ranges increasingly inhospitable skiers  A new report year European title: Flamenco Is Alive After Paco De Luca
text: Flamenco Is Alive After Paco De Luca Enlarge image toggle caption Luis Malibran Courtesy artist Luis Malibran Courtesy artist The guitarist Paco de Luca died three years ago  leaving behind immense impact flamenco music  He expanded strict  traditional form adding jazz world music influences  collaborating musicians outside genre  Members last touring band  led guitarist producer Javier Limn  currently road Flamenco Legends  revisiting late guitarist s music paying tribute legacy  The tour fittingly called The Paco de Luca Project  Limn says loss namesake felt long time   We lost leader even bigger flamenco itself  says   Paco de Luca like  Astor  Piazzolla like  Carlos  Gardel tango  Paco de Luca like  Antonio Carlos  Jobim bossa nova  like Miles Davis jazz  And I think we re going need decades musician guitarist big  The flamenco guitar primarily instrument accompany singers  Then came great guitarists genre  Ramn Montoya  nephew Carlos Montoya  Sabicas Nio de Ricardo everything  Limn says besides  best flamenco guitarist ever  de Luca also consummate composer musician   He great producer  says   He producer Camarn de la Isla s albums many others  So created  producer  new sound band  Now band tour  people might ask   Why present programs de Luca s band without leader  Which  Limn says  fair question   All artists  young members band  good leaders good soloists  says   So opportunity get deeper every one them  So even without Paco  sound there  sound band there  That important value  Nevertheless  another flamenco guitarist  Ral Rodrguez  says what s missing today s flamenco scene guiding creative figure   For many decades  flamenco thought music that s already made  already finished  Rodrguez says   So now  it s much miss Paco de Luca  it s urgently need creative minds within music don t repeat old scheme  else it s going fall asleep  Though void left de Luca take long time fill  Limn believes future looks bright  long artists learn roots flamenco embrace open ears de Luca brought music   We need really get deep knowledge rhythm  harmony  sound  melody  Limn says   And quality  basically  It s quality  He adds there s still plenty room make flamenco bigger musical language  And it s important ever keep playing many audiences possible

title: Is It Legal For An Older Man To Court A Child Bride In The U S
text: Is It Legal For An Older Man To Court A Child Bride In The U S  Enlarge image Maria Fabrizio NPR Maria Fabrizio NPR Editor s Note  This story originally published August updated  The national news week dominated accusations U S  Senate candidate Roy Moore   allegations sexually assaulted least two teenage girls also attempted date teenagers 30s  Moore denies allegations  But stories prompted discussion certain  courting  practice pockets fundamentalist Christian community Moore belongs  Older men ask young women  including teenagers  parent s permission eye toward marriage  All raises question  Isn t child marriage   one partners 18   illegal U S  Child marriage isn t practice victimizes girls poor countries  As blog previously reported  it s also long issue United States  involving girls wide range backgrounds  Based state marriage license data sources  advocacy groups experts estimate 2000 2015 alone  well 200 000 children   nearly girls   married  In nearly cases husband adult  A report released summer Tahirih Justice Center sheds new light state laws contributing problem  The center  nonprofit advocacy group works end violence women girls  comprehensive analysis myriad statutes governing marriage 50 states District Columbia  Among findings  Twenty five states set minimum age person get married  eight set age lower 16  Alaska North Carolina  example  set age 14  In New Hampshire it s 13 girls  14 boys  In states  minors certain age   varies state state   must still get judge s approval marry  But report finds hardly robust protection exploitation children  For instance  states specify ruling judge must work court system gives expertise matters   say family  juvenile domestic relations court  Similarly  states require child appointed counsel  Only two state laws specify judge cannot approve marriage solely child s parents consented  And nine states expressly permit pregnancy reason lower minimum marriage age  All problematic makes hard ensure girl isn t pressured marriage family adult partner who  marriage  would subject prosecution statutory rape  What s more  even states officially set age marriage 16 higher  judges generally allowed overrule limit let child marriage go forward  The Tahirih Justice Center hopes report spur lawmakers make changes state s statutes  So far  progress slower advocates would like  But interest issue growing last two years Virginia  Texas New York passed legislation report celebrated putting place  meaningful safeguards  Before New York  marriage formally allowed children young 14  judge s permission  Now   age floor  set 17  even then  approval required judge must determine minor coerced  among criteria  And minor appointed attorney training domestic violence forced marriage

title: Republican Senators Add Repeal Of Individual Health Care Mandate To Tax Bill
text: Republican Senators Add Repeal Of Individual Health Care Mandate To Tax Bill Enlarge image toggle caption J  Scott Applewhite AP J  Scott Applewhite AP Updated 5 56 p m  ET Senate Republicans plan try repeal Affordable Care Act s individual mandate part tax overhaul bill  Several Senate Republicans said Tuesday including repeal tax legislation  currently making way key Senate committee  would allow reduce tax rates individuals without adding deficit  The decision rapid change direction Republicans  previously believed would politically dangerous add health care measure tax legislation  Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell told reporters Tuesday members Senate Finance Committee believe tacking repeal ensure bill sufficient votes pass comes vote Senate   We re optimistic inserting individual mandate repeal would helpful  McConnell said   and that s obviously view Senate Finance Committee Republicans well  The Congressional Budget Office said last week repeal would reduce federal deficits  338 billion next 10 years  would help GOP avoid exceeding  1 5 trillion cap much tax bill add deficit time period  The repeal would also increase number uninsured 13 million 2027  according CBO  Sen  John Thune  R S D  top McConnell deputy  said savings repeal would give Republicans room cut taxes middle class   It distributed form middle income tax relief  Thune said   It probably mean adjusting rate structure today  We ll probably still seven brackets  would different rates  Asked confident bill could pass  Thune said yes  adding leaders already  whipped  bill  meaning already know colleagues vote  Not Republicans agree decision  Moderate Sen  Susan Collins  R Maine  said decided vote tax bill  worries ending individual mandate could increase health care premiums   I personally think complicates tax reform put repeal individual mandate there  Collins said   I m going wait see bill says  But adding could appeal skeptics legislation  including Sen  Rand Paul  R Ky  supports individual mandate repeal  The Senate Finance Committee expected release updated version legislation Tuesday evening  The committee plans approve bill later week hopes holding vote full Senate Thanksgiving  Republicans Finance Committee worked around clock recent days try bring long term cost tax bill  Republicans want take advantage complicated Senate budget rules  known reconciliation  would allow pass tax bill 51 votes rather 60 needed legislation  That would allow 52 Senate Republicans pass bill without help Democrats  But budget rules require tax overhaul add deficit 10 years  The Senate bill appeared violate regulations recently Tuesday morning  Repealing individual mandate could help ease fiscal pressure  Democrats  enraged McConnell s announcement  said adding individual mandate legislation effectively ended chance bipartisan agreement taxes  Sen  Ron Wyden  D Ore  top Democrat Finance Committee  said repealing mandate would hurt middle class   In desperation secure ideological trophy  matter consequences  Wyden said   Republicans choosing pay corporate tax cuts raising premiums middle class families ripping away health care title: Wrongfully convicted man Wilbert Jones freed 45 years
text: As Wilbert Jones emerged Louisiana prison  free first time 45 years  asked reporter harbors resentment authorities withheld evidence case years ago   I forgave I forgive  Jones said  citing faith God giving hope incarceration  helping focus future  Jones  65  19 police arrested suspicion abducting nurse gunpoint Baton Rouge hospital s parking lot raping behind building night Oct  2  1971  Jones convicted aggravated rape 1974 retrial sentenced life prison without possibility parole  The judge overturned conviction called case Jones  weak  best  noting authorities withheld evidence could exonerated Jones decades ago   Most life taken away something I didn t do  Jones said  moments stepping outside free man first time century   I feel wonderful I thank God opportunity  Jones said   And I thank God legal team  The non profit Innocence Project New Orleans represented Jones since 2003  Jones said plans day included enjoying long awaited meal gumbo potato salad family  His brother  Plem Jones  said he s always known meal would come   I might missed  only  one two visits there  We d sit talk cry together  Plem Jones said   I never gave him  I knew didn t it  matter time  I didn t know when  Though Jones credited faith helping persevere  admitted decades spent prison innocent man easy   It s difficult  I mean very difficult  Jones said  The state s case Jones  rested entirely  nurse s testimony  questionable identification  Jones assailant  judge said  The nurse  died 2008  picked Jones police lineup three months rape  But also told police man raped taller  much rougher  voice Jones had  Jones  lawyers claim nurse s description matches man arrested never charged rape woman abducted parking lot another Baton Rouge hospital  27 days nurse s attack  The man also arrested suspicion raping yet another woman 1973  charged convicted armed robbery case  Anderson said evidence shows police knew similarities man nurse s description attacker   Nevertheless  state failed provide information defense  wrote  Prosecutors  argued state required notify defense information  said ask Louisiana Supreme Court review judge s decision  intend retry Jones

title: A s trade young slugger Ryon Healy Seattle Mariners

title: Nearby Earth sized world may best candidate yet search alien life
text: Another tantalizing planet found outside Solar System  Earth sized world that s cosmic next door neighbor   could right spot host life  Meet Ross 128 b  newly discovered planet found orbiting around small  faint star known red dwarf  The world  one and a half times mass Earth  may star s habitable zone  too   That s spot temperatures right  possibly allowing liquid water pool planet s surface  Most exciting planet situated 11 light years away  That makes Ross 128 b second closest potentially habitable exoplanet Earth know Proxima b  rocky world orbits around nearest star Solar System  Proxima Centauri   The planet found around one quietest stars solar neighborhood  However  Proxima Centauri isn t  life friendly  star  Also red dwarf  it s considered active star  meaning frequently burps intense  high energy solar flares  In fact  red dwarfs prone flaring  bad news search alien life outside Solar System  Flaring stars blast nearby planets lots radiation  stripping away atmospheres making uninhabitable  But Ross 128 b s star doesn t seem flare much all   The planet found around one quietest stars solar neighborhood  Xavier Bonfils  astronomer Institute Planetology Astrophysics Grenoble  France lead author study Astronomy   Astrophysics detailing planet s discovery  tells The Verge  That makes planetary system much conducive hosting potential life  Bonfils team spent decade monitoring red dwarf  called Ross 128  figured planet lurking around it  The researchers used HARPS instrument European Southern Observatory s La Silla Observatory Chile periodically observe star s minuscule wobbles  Orbiting planets  tiny  gravitationally tug star  causing star shake orbit  After taking 116 measurements HARPS  team able conclude Earth sized planet orbiting around star  Because planet low mass  researchers pretty sure it s rocky like Earth  And based wobble measurements  researchers found Ross 128 b close sun  orbit takes 10 Earth days complete  That puts planet 20 times closer star Earth Sun  But star also 280 times less luminous Sun  Ross 128 b receives 40 percent light Earth does  That means planet may surface temperature similar Earth  Depending much light reflects back space  planet could right temperatures needed liquid water  All that  combined fact Ross 128 inactive star  makes planet prime candidate search extraterrestrial life   We found extremely interesting planets like ones orbiting Proxima Centauri TRAPPIST 1  however stars present best conditions life  Nicola Astudillo Defru  astronomer University Geneva Switzerland another lead author study  wrote email The Verge   Hence  likely  we ll  find  signs life  Ross 128 b star  Of course  there s still lot don t know planet  Sure  seems lot good stats  scientists still don t know planet s climate like  could seriously impact habitability  Bonfils says it s possible clouds accumulate side planet facing star  could reflect lot star s radiation space  If so  could prevent planet overheating  However  planet could also particularly dark  causing absorb much light trigger runway greenhouse effect  We won t know sure kind atmosphere planet look directly  may happen while  There aren t really telescopes available right see Ross 128 b directly   For continue monitor star search additional companions  wrote Astudillo Defru  But new giant telescope built Chile   aptly named Extremely Large Telescope  ELT   could use peer planet s atmosphere  When it s running sometime around 2025  ELT may powerful enough directly image Earth sized exoplanets figure atmospheres made of  If ELT see Ross 128 b s atmosphere find critical gases associated life   water vapor  oxygen  methane   scientists better idea whether life present   If able identify three  gases  exoplanet atmosphere  would smoking gun life surface  says Bonfils

title: Australians overwhelmingly endorse gay marriage  clearing way Parliament

conducted mail found 61 6 percent Australians favor allowing gay couples wed  Even though measure expected approved  size win unusually large participation 12 7 million Australians 16 million eligible voters added political legitimacy  Though vote isn t binding  major political party leaders promised implement decision  would make Australia one approximately 26 countries allow gay couples wed   The text: Karsten Moran The New York Times How Does Pressure Cooker Work  Dating 17th century  first pressurized cooking pot developed French physicist Denis Papin  Basically pot tight sealing lid steam valve  pressure cooker traps steam rising boiling liquid pot  which  turn  raises temperature liquid boils   For example  without pressure  water sea level boils 212 degrees  Under pressure  temperature rise much 266 degrees  The higher temperature  combined pressure pot forces hot steam ingredients  cooks food much faster traditional methods  A pressure cooker works different pressure levels  one changing boiling point liquid  With pressure cookers today  pressure gauge preset two options  At low pressure  10 pounds per square inch  p s i  internal temperature reaches 235 degrees  At high pressure  15 pounds p s i  reach 250 degrees  A steam valve allows excess steam escape  keeping pressure cooker exploding  but  countless tales split pea soups ceiling attest  historically title: How We Made Candidates Speak 30 Times Slower
text: How We Made Candidates Speak 30 Times Slower Earlier month  TIME published series slow motion videos 2016 presidential campaign events Iowa  overlaid audio candidates speaking haunting title: How Much Would You Make You Were Man
text: How Much Would You Make You Were Man  Take interactive quiz find President Barack Obama revisiting issue marked beginning presidency  Equal pay men women  On Jan  29  seven years day Obama signed effect Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act  acknowledged wage gap still persists alarming degree and introduced several new measures help address problem  One efforts proposal increase amount data federal government receives employee pay  But great deal information already exists detailed data collected Census annual American Community Survey  According new analysis TIME Motto  women earn less men every age range  15  less ages 22 25 staggering 38  less ages 51 64  We analyzed wages earned 15 million Americans surveyed Census Bureau 2008 2012  classified 460 different occupational categories  We found 372 occupations contained enough information determine statistically significant gender pay gap least one seven age ranges examined  In all  found 1 490 combinations age occupation existed statistically significant difference much men women make  Only 22 1 490 involved women making money men  All 22 situations women out earned men occurred among youngest cohorts occupation   The gaps statistically significant least 90  level confidence  threshold Census uses  There single occupation women age 30 took home significantly higher average salaries male colleagues  even start making much more  Looking earning patterns secondary school teachers helps tell story  From ages 22 25  women actually earn 10  male colleagues  By time teachers turn 30  statistical difference male peers  By 35  men make more  It s pattern see repeated librarians  social workers  secretaries preschool teachers  Notably  female dominated professions  In male dominated professions like engineering finance  women typically make less start  Some occupations stand particularly egregious research  For example  tax preparation industry  sample 5 000 people  one worst records pay disparity job country  From ages 26 30  female tax preparers  average  earn around half much male counterparts  It gets worse there  Among 41 50  women tax preparation business bring home third much male colleagues  One explanation pay disparity many occupations offer higher  lower paying tracks  We could hypothesize  instance  female lawyers choose public service male lawyers choose high paying firms  perhaps explaining male lawyers 40s earn 51  female counterparts  But sheer breadth occupations men make women suggests something self selection tracks  For instance  male dishwashers 50s paid 20  female dishwashers  Male janitors 40s paid 63  more  Joining profession women make majority workers may give women pay advantage either or even parity  There research show female dominated professions  men get promoted quickly women field  effect termed  glass escalator  Male female registered nurses  research shows  make roughly pay youngest cohorts  significant wage gap open 30s beyond  The survey confirm men women certain high paying professions  financial analysts  dentists  women certain low paying professions  teaching assistants  telemarketers  But within professions  men still make significantly more  Having women higher paying professions  words  would eliminate overall gap  Some point fact women remain primary caregivers many families cause wages lagging behind men  A woman might leave work force raise child returns enter lower wage never catch up  While may happen places  childcare alone cannot account vast inequality measured across almost every profession age group  The calculations analysis exclude anyone earn income  include part time workers  While men work part time still tend earn women work part time  occupations age cohorts female part timers outnumber male part timers  This could explain gap groups  cannot explain all  Researchers found among full time workers still intractable gap  even controlling things like occupational segregation employment gaps due maternity childcare  Alarmingly  discrimination happens promotion season job candidate first shows company  In variety professions  male dominated female dominated  experiments shown employers biased toward male job candidates  In 2012 double blind study  science faculty research universities asked rate identical resumes lab tech position  one male name one female name  When name resume John  faculty suggested higher starting salary name resume Jennifer  About authors Amelia Showalter  data analytics expert political consultant  director digital analytics Barack Obama s 2012 presidential campaign  Chris Wilson director data journalism Time com  Source  IPUMS USA  University Minnesota  www ipums org

title: How Much Would You Make You Were Man
text: How Much Would You Make You Were Man  Take interactive quiz find President Barack Obama revisiting issue marked beginning presidency  Equal pay men women  On Jan  29  seven years day Obama signed effect Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act  acknowledged wage gap still persists alarming degree and introduced several new measures help address problem  One efforts proposal increase amount data federal government receives employee pay  But great deal information already exists detailed data collected Census annual American Community Survey  According new analysis TIME Motto  women earn less men every age range  15  less ages 22 25 staggering 38  less ages 51 64  We analyzed wages earned 15 million Americans surveyed Census Bureau 2008 2012  classified 460 different occupational categories  We found 372 occupations contained enough information determine statistically significant gender pay gap least one seven age ranges examined  In all  found 1 490 combinations age occupation existed statistically significant difference much men women make  Only 22 1 490 involved women making money men  All 22 situations women out earned men occurred among youngest cohorts occupation   The gaps statistically significant least 90  level confidence  threshold Census uses  There single occupation women age 30 took home significantly higher average salaries male colleagues  even start making much more  Looking earning patterns secondary school teachers helps tell story  From ages 22 25  women actually earn 10  male colleagues  By time teachers turn 30  statistical difference male peers  By 35  men make more  It s pattern see repeated librarians  social workers  secretaries preschool teachers  Notably  female dominated professions  In male dominated professions like engineering finance  women typically make less start  Some occupations stand particularly egregious research  For example  tax preparation industry  sample 5 000 people  one worst records pay disparity job country  From ages 26 30  female tax preparers  average  earn around half much male counterparts  It gets worse there  Among 41 50  women tax preparation business bring home third much male colleagues  One explanation pay disparity many occupations offer higher  lower paying tracks  We could hypothesize  instance  female lawyers choose public service male lawyers choose high paying firms  perhaps explaining male lawyers 40s earn 51  female counterparts  But sheer breadth occupations men make women suggests something self selection tracks  For instance  male dishwashers 50s paid 20  female dishwashers  Male janitors 40s paid 63  more  Joining profession women make majority workers may give women pay advantage either or even parity  There research show female dominated professions  men get promoted quickly women field  effect termed  glass escalator  Male female registered nurses  research shows  make roughly pay youngest cohorts  significant wage gap open 30s beyond  The survey confirm men women certain high paying professions  financial analysts  dentists  women certain low paying professions  teaching assistants  telemarketers  But within professions  men still make significantly more  Having women higher paying professions  words  would eliminate overall gap  Some point fact women remain primary caregivers many families cause wages lagging behind men  A woman might leave work force raise child returns enter lower wage never catch up  While may happen places  childcare alone cannot account vast inequality measured across almost every profession age group  The calculations analysis exclude anyone earn income  include part time workers  While men work part time still tend earn women work part time  occupations age cohorts female part timers outnumber male part timers  This could explain gap groups  cannot explain all  Researchers found among full time workers still intractable gap  even controlling things like occupational segregation employment gaps due maternity childcare  Alarmingly  discrimination happens promotion season job candidate first shows company  In variety professions  male dominated female dominated  experiments shown employers biased toward male job candidates  In 2012 double blind study  science faculty research universities asked rate identical resumes lab tech position  one male name one female name  When title: The Republican tax plan s five worst dangers
text: Robert E  Rubin  co chairman emeritus Council Foreign Relations  U S  treasury secretary 1995 1999  The deficit funded tax cuts advancing Congress fiscal tragedy country pay huge price time  While details tax plan remain flux  fundamental contours change  Nor  1 5 trillion deficit funding  amount stipulated recently passed budget resolution  Perhaps it s hopeless expect Congress long bemoaned deficits debt oppose plan  If  however  matter conscience renewed reflection decide take heed  fiscal dangers posed plan  To start  tax cuts increase growth and  given fiscal effects  would likely significant increasingly negative impact  The nonpartisan Tax Policy Center s latest report estimated that  10 years  average increase growth rate would roughly zero  counting crowding private investment increasing deficits counting adverse effects worsening fiscal outlook  The Penn Wharton Budget Model  using approach  estimates virtually increase long term growth  Goldman Sachs projects increase 0 1 percent 0 2 percent first couple years average increase 10 years 0 05 percent per year  counting adverse fiscal effects  These estimates reflect three underlying views held mainstream economists  First  individual tax cuts materially induce people work more  Second  corporate tax cuts likely limited effect investment decisions locate business activity  given many variables play  Third  deficit funded tax cuts little short term effect growth  except perhaps temporary overheating  roughly full employment  With additional revenue increased growth offset tax cuts  cost  publicly held debt federal government would increase  1 5 trillion  An additional danger actual deficit impact would increased abandoning Congressional Budget Office s nonpartisan evaluation used decades parties favor partisan calculations pushing tax cuts  Adding  1 5 trillion federal debt would make already bad situation worse  A useful measure fiscal position ratio publicly held government debt economic output gross domestic product  called debt GDP ratio  In 2000  debt GDP ratio 32 percent  The ratio 77 percent  Looking forward  CBO projects debt GDP ratio 91 percent 2027 150 percent 2047  After  1 5 trillion deficit funded tax cuts  future ratios estimated increase roughly 97 percent 2027 160 percent 2047  These estimates likely substantially understate worsening fiscal trajectory  That s account increasingly adverse effect growth difficult to quantify effects fiscal deterioration  Exacerbating already unsustainable fiscal trajectory tax cuts would threaten growth five respects  These highly likely substantial increase time  First  business confidence would likely negatively affected creating uncertainty future policy heightening concern political system s ability meet economic policy challenges  Second  country s resilience deal inevitable future economic geopolitical emergencies  including effects climate change  would continue decline  Third  funds available public investment  national security defense spending   professed concern many tax cut proponents   would continue decline debt rises  rising interest costs increased risk borrowing fund government activities  Fourth  Treasury bond interest rates would highly likely increase time increased demand supply savings increased concern future imbalances  That  turn  would raise private sector interest rates  could also increase due widening spreads vs  Treasuries  reflecting increased concern future conditions  And even limited increase debt GDP ratio could focus attention fiscal trajectory s long ignored risks trigger outsize increases Treasury private sector interest rates  The ability borrow currency  print Federal Reserve  may diminish risks while  might capital inflows abroad  But mitigating factors limits  point  unsound fiscal conditions almost surely would undermine currency debt markets  Finally  unpredictable point  fiscal conditions   market dynamics   would likely seen sufficiently serious cause severe market economic destabilization  We imperative need address unsustainable longer term fiscal trajectory sound economic policies  Few elected officials want face fact  but  least  make matters worse  We hope responsible elected officials prevent irresponsible tax plan adopted

without inviting stress kitchen  too  Whatever case  I meal   along strategies back up  This lineup feels familiar jaded  best all  it s simple prepare   No need start countdown 18 days advance  My menu offers flavors memories traditional meal recipes hard mess   won t crowd oven  At end day  Thanksgiving winning awards tackled complicated  intimidating set recipes  Worrying  particularly something easily control  way anyone wants spend Thanksgiving  or day  matter  Instead  follow advice  mind set calm welcoming  That s godsend  important part meal isn t actually what s table  chance connect people sitting around it  reflect gratitude  Jump recipes  Here s set things right track beginning  starting planning  Roasted Sweet Potatoes With Sour Cream   Toasted Pumpkin Seeds let avoid pitfalls mashed potatoes   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  1  Keep scope meal small manageable  Choose carefully  You don t tick every box  Just so and so grew two types stuffing another guest waxes poetic three desserts doesn t mean make them  You nostalgic flavors handful simple dishes  Besides  fewer dishes  easier calculations many servings make   My selection recipes adds plentiful meal eight  they re easily scalable  Skip prepared appetizers  They fill everyone meal  anyhow  Instead  serve drinks bowls peanuts pistachios   perhaps whole radishes  olives  cornichons jarred marinated artichoke hearts  Forget cocktails  unless can t imagine Thanksgiving without one  Stick beer  wine nonalcoholic beverages apple cider sparkling water  If want cocktail  make one pitcher drink punch don t play bartender  2  Decide delegate  Some good candidates    Drinks and or ice   By way  cold porch  that s great place put drinks make room fridge   kitchen    The table setting  Ask someone bring miniature pumpkins and or clementines  set rest guests arrive   Or consider days advance  pumpkins clementines sit days without wilting needing water    Cranberry sauce   Or buy stuff can  many people love    Dessert   If want make it  though  read easy  delicious idea    Final prep help  Brown Butter Green Beans blanched day meal warmed browned butter serving time   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  3  Cook everything turkey day before  This renders moot question prepare multiple dishes they re ready time  Two side dishes dessert bake temperature  maximum timing flexibility    A simple bread stuffing   reheated serving    Green beans   warm nutty browned butter mealtime    Roasted sweet potatoes   rewarmed  split  dolloped sour cream topped crunchy pumpkin seeds   This allows avoid mashed potato pitfalls peeling  chopping uneven reheating    Apple gingerbread cake  good  better  sits day  involves rolling pie dough  mixer frosting  The turkey turns beautifully brining  basting marinating   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  4  Think turkey big chicken skip fuss  Don t brine  baste  marinate stuff  Simply season generously salt  add water pan  roast couple hours  I like set little rack made celery  helps circulate air underneath it  plus gives yummy celery  But even this  skip  Buy least five days advance  If it s fresh  last week fridge  If it s frozen  stay way months  needs 24 hours defrosting refrigerator every 4 pounds  So 12  14 pound bird I call feed eight people  start defrosting Saturday safe   You defrost size bird nine hours sink container filled cold water  you ll change water every half hour  Once turkey defrosted  remove giblets neck they re included save stock  Let turkey rest roasts least 20 minutes  Really  It makes difference bird s juiciness  Make easy gravy doesn t require intimidating roux run risk getting lumpy  While turkey rests  whisk sour cream pan juices  It couldn t easier  result tastes like pure cold water let simmer you re eating  at least two hours  ideally four  Later  strain stock use soup next day  Add whatever turkey leftover plus cooked rice barley eat topped grated cheese parsley title: Militr bernimmt Macht Simbabwe
text: Harare  Reuters    In Simbabwe hat das Militr nach eigenen Angaben die Macht bernommen  Ziel sei es  gegen  Kriminelle  im Umfeld von Prsident Robert Mugabe vorzugehen  sagte Generalmajor SB Moyo Mittwoch im staatlichen Fernsehen  Soldiers stand beside military vehicles outside Harare  Zimbabwe November 14  2017  REUTERS Philimon Bulawayo Der 93 jhrige Prsident und dessen Familie seien Sicherheit   ihnen gehe es gut  Sdafrikas Prsident Jacob Zuma erklrte  Mugabe habe ihm einem Telefonat gesagt  dass er unter Hausarrest stehe  Es gehe ihm aber gut  In der Hauptstadt Harare blockierten Soldaten und gepanzerte Fahrzeuge die Zufahrtsstraen zu den wichtigsten Regierungsgebuden  zum Parlament und zu den Gerichten  Das Militr mit dem Putsch offenbar verhindern  dass Mugabes 52 jhrige Frau Grace die Spitze des Staates rckt  Ihr Aufstieg und der ihr nachgesagte ausschweifende Lebensstil werden selbst von vielen Anhngern des 93 jhrigen Staatschefs abgelehnt  Generalmajor Moyo sagte  Verbrechen der  Kriminellen  um Mugabe htten soziales und wirtschaftliches Leid verursacht  Die Verantwortlichen mssten vor Gericht gestellt werden   Sobald wir unsere Mission erfllt haben  erwarten wir eine Rckkehr zur Normalitt  BUNDESREGIERUNG RUFT ZU GEWALTVERZICHT AUF Die Bundesregierung rief alle Konfliktparteien zum Gewaltverzicht auf   Erforderlich ist ein Dialog der Akteure  um eine Konfrontation zu vermeiden und zu einer friedlichen Lsung zu kommen  sagte ein Sprecher des Auswrtigen Amtes   nL8N1NL4MU  Die deutsche Botschaft bleibt ebenso wie die Vertretungen anderer Staaten geschlossen  Deutschland  die USA und Grobritannien empfahlen ihren Staatsbrgern Simbabwe  wegen der unsicheren Lage den Husern zu bleiben  Auch der britische Auenminister Boris Johnson appellierte alle Seiten der ehemaligen Kolonie  keine Gewalt anzuwenden  Sdafrikas Prsident Zuma kndigte an  seiner Eigenschaft als Vorsitzender der Entwicklungsgemeinschaft des sdlichen Afrika einen Sondergesandten nach Simbabwe zu schicken  Dieser solle mit Mugabe und Armeevertretern zusammenkommen  In den Straen der Hauptstadt patrouillierten Soldaten  Das Militr besetzte den staatlichen Fernsehsender  Augenzeugen zufolge erschtterten drei Explosionen das Zentrum von Harare  Insgesamt schien es aber ruhig der Metropole  ENTLASSUNG DES VIZEPRSIDENTEN SORGTE FR ESKALATION Militrchef Constantino Chiwenga hatte Anfang der Woche der Regierung gedroht einzugreifen  nachdem Vizeprsident Emmerson Mnangagwa entlassen worden war  Mnangagwa galt bis dahin offiziell als Nachfolger Mugabes  Seine Entlassung sollte offenbar den Weg fr Grace Mugabe die Staatsspitze freimachen  Das sorgte nicht nur bei vielen Veteranen des Unabhngigkampfes fr Unmut  sondern auch der Armeefhrung  die Mnangagwa untersttzte  Einige Generle erklrten  sie wrden niemanden der Spitze des Staates akzeptieren  der nicht im Unabhngigkeitskrieg den 70er Jahren gekmpft habe  Mugabe fhrt die Geschicke des Landes seit der Unabhngigkeit 1980  Beunruhigt ber die Entwicklung war anscheinend auch China  das wirtschaftlich Simbabwe stark engagiert ist und viele Rohstoffe von dort bezieht  Vorige Woche reiste Simbabwes Armeechef Chiwenga nach Peking  wo er von Verteidigungsminister Chang Wanquan empfangen wurde  Chinas Regierung sprach von einem normalen militrischen Austausch  Der Besuch stehe keinem Zusammenhang mit den aktuellen Entwicklungen nL8N1NL2SE  SIMBABWE SEIT DER UNABHNGIGKEIT IM NIEDERGANG Simbabwe war den 80er Jahren eines der wirtschaftlich erfolgreichsten Lnder Afrikas  Inzwischen steckt es einer anhaltend tiefen Wirtschaftskrise  fr die Gegner  aber auch langjhrige Wegbegleiter Mugabes den Prsidenten verantwortlich machen  Zugleich fhlt sich die alte Garde der Guerillakmpfer des Unabhngigkeitskrieges von Mugabes Frau Grace ins Abseits gestellt  die sich vor allem auf die Parteijugend sttzt   Das ist die Korrektur eines Staates Abgrund  sagte Chris Mutsvangwa  der Fhrer der Veteranen des Befreiungskrieges und fgt hinzu   Das ist das Ende eines sehr schmerzvollen und traurigen Kapitels einer jungen Nation  dem ein Diktator  als er alt wurde  seinen Hof einer Bande von Dieben um seine Frau berlie   nL8N1NL422  Finanzminister Ignatius Chombo  der zur einflussreichen Gruppe um Grace Mugabe gethlt wird  wurde nach Informationen aus Regierungskreisen festgenommen  Simbabwe trudelt derzeit wieder eine schwere Wirtschaftskrise  Viele befrchten  dass sie noch schlimmer werden knnte als der Zusammenbruch 2007 2008  Damals lag die Inflationsrate der Spitze bei 500 Milliarden Prozent  Gegenwrtig werden bereits wieder Importgter knapp  Die Inflationsrate liegt bei 50 Prozent im Monat  Aus Geheimdienstdokumenten  die die Nachrichtenagentur Reuters Einblick erhielt  geht hervor  dass der entlassene Vizeprsident Mnangagwa fr eine Wiederbelebung der Wirtschaft Tausende vor 20 Jahren von ihrem Land vertriebene weie Farmer wieder ins Land holen wollte  Auerdem wollte er den Dokumenten zufolge die abgebrochenen Beziehungen zur Weltbank und zum Internationalen Whrungsfonds wiederherstellen

title: Exrcito Zimbbue toma poder e visa  criminosos  prximos de Mugabe
text: HARARE  Reuters    Os militares Zimbbue tomaram poder incio desta quarta feira visando  criminosos  prximos presidente Robert Mugabe  mas foram  televiso nacional para garantir que lder de 93 anos e sua famlia esto  sos e salvos  Veculos militares e soldados patrulham ruas de Harare 15 11 2017 REUTERS Philimon Bulawayo Soldados e veculos blindados interditaram ruas que do acesso aos escritrios governo  Parlamento e dos tribunais centro de Harare  e txis transportavam trabalhadores entorno da capital para seu empregos nas proximidades  disse uma testemunha da Reuters  Mugabe  encarnao  Grande Velho  da poltica africana  comandou Zimbbue durante os ltimos 37 anos  Contrastando com sua condio privilegiada continente  ele  repudiado Ocidente  que v como um dspota cujos manejo desastroso da economia e disposio de recorrer  violncia para se manter poder destruram um dos Estados mais promissores da frica   S estamos visando criminosos ao redor dele  Mugabe  que esto cometendo crimes que esto causando sofrimento social e econmico pas para poder lev los  justia  disse major general SB Moyo  chefe de logstica Estado Maior  na TV   Assim que tivermos realizado nossa misso  acreditamos que situao voltar  normalidade  Nem Mugabe nem sua esposa  Grace  que vinha almejando suced lo como presidente  foram vistos  nem se tem notcias dos dois  O partido opositor Movimento pela Mudana Democrtica pediu uma volta pacfica  democracia constitucional  acrescentando esperar que interveno militar leve ao  estabelecimento de um Estado nao estvel  democrtico e progressista  Falando em nome da Comunidade de Desenvolvimento Sul Africana  SADC  na sigla em ingls  presidente da frica Sul  Jacob Zuma  expressou esperana de que no ocorram mudanas inconstitucionais de governo Zimbbue  j que isso seria contrrio  posio da SADC e da Unio Africana  Zuma exortou governo e os militares Zimbbue  a resolverem impasse poltico amistosamente

title: Sri Lanka talks Hathurusingha coach s job
text: COLOMBO  Reuters    Sri Lanka talks hire former opening batsman Chandika Hathurusingha coach  Sports Minister Dayasiri Jayasekara said Wednesday  Britain Cricket   Bangladesh Press Conference   Edgbaston   June 13  2017 Bangladesh s Coach Chandika Hathurusingha press conference Action Images via Reuters   Andrew Boyers Livepic Hathurusingha resigned head coach Bangladesh last week  amid media speculation set take charge Sri Lanka   I hope mostly deal go through  Jayasekara told reporters Colombo   He taken Bangladesh higher level   We invited take  the role of  Sri Lanka coach I approve definitely  Sri Lanka without permanent coach since Graham Ford  meant charge 2019 World Cup  quit June  Since Sri Lanka whitewashed three match test series India well five match one day series opponents  They also lost one day series Pakistan 5 0 last month

title: Presidente peruano Kuczynski rejeita acusaes de ter trabalhado para Odebrecht
text: LIMA  Reuters    O presidente Peru  Pedro Pablo Kuczynski  garantiu nesta quarta feira que  falsa acusao de que construtora brasileira Odebrecht  envolvida em diversos escndalos de corrupo na Amrica Latina  contratou como consultor financeiro h uma dcada  Kuczynski acena durante reunio Vietn 11 11 2017 REUTERS Jorge Silva Em uma breve mensagem televisionada  nao  Kuczynski negou ter recebido dinheiro da Odebrecht em suas campanhas para eleies presidenciais de 2011 e 2016  O maior jornal Peru  El Comercio  relatou na segunda feira que ex presidente da companhia brasileira Marcelo Odebrecht acusou Kuczynski de ter trabalhado para construtora aps governo de Alejandro Toledo  2001 2006  quando Kuczynski foi um dos ministros da Economia  De acordo com jornal  Marcelo Odebrecht  que foi interrogado por promotores peruanos Brasil  destacou que empresa brasileira havia financiado campanhas de candidatos presidenciais peruanos   Afirma que depois de ter sido ministro  contratou como consultor financeiro de tal empresa  Esta suposta afirmao tambm  falsa  disse Kuczynski   No recebi nenhum repasse de tal empresa em nenhuma de minhas campanhas eleitorais  acrescentou presidente peruano  de 79 anos  A Reuters no conseguiu confirmar que Marcelo Odebrecht disse promotores peruanos em Curitiba   Como chefe de Estado  apoio luta contra corrupo em todos os seus nveis  afirmou Kuczynski    fundamental que todos lutem contra corrupo  esta luta tem meu compromisso  Kuczunski  que assumiu em julho ano passado em mandato de cinco anos  rejeitou qualquer vnculo profissional com Odebrecht  mbito de uma investigao realizada pelo Congresso dominado pela oposio
