title: Departamento de Justicia EEUU tienta fiscales para bloquear fusin AT T Time Warner  fuente
text: WASHINGTON  Reuters    El Departamento de Justicia de Estados Unidos se ha acercado fiscales de estados en un intento por bloquear la compra de Time Warner Inc por parte de AT T Inc por 85 400 millones de dlares  dijo el mircoles Reuters una fuente con conocimiento del tema  Una pantalla con el precio de cotizacin de acciones de Time Warner en la bolsa de Wall Street en Nueva York  nov 15  2017  REUTERS Lucas Jackson No estaba claro cules estados se haba acercado el Gobierno federal si alguno haba aceptado unirse una potencial demanda para suspender la operacin  anunciada en octubre de 2016  El acuerdo ha atravesado una revisin antimonopolio que se ha alargado ms de un ao se ha vuelto un foco de tensin poltica debido la promesa del presidente Donald Trump cuando an era candidato de bloquear el acuerdo sus repetidas crticas CNN  propiedad de Time Warner  La fuente dijo que el Departamento de Justicia se contact con un grupo de 18 fiscales estatales que previamente haban optado por unirse la revisin para ver si queran participar de una demanda  Los fiscales estatales han estado evaluando si la fusin daa la competencia  entrevistaron ejecutivos del sector como parte de la revisin del acuerdo  aadi la fuente  El Departamento  que puede por si solo presentar la demanda para frenar la fusin  logr convencer ningn estado para que se sume una potencial demanda  report CNBC  Otras fuentes dijeron la semana pasada que el Departamento de Justicia haba exigido que AT T se desprenda de DirecTV de la unidad Turner Broadcasting de Time Warner  que incluye CNN  para obtener la aprobacin de la adquisicin  Trump  quien acaba de regresar de un viaje por Asia  atac nuevamente la cadena el mircoles por la maana  al escribir en Twitter   Mientras estuve en Filipinas vi forzado ver  CNN  algo que haca desde hace meses  nuevamente di cuenta cun malo  FALSO  es   Perdedor  Las acciones de AT T suban un 0 4 por ciento  mientras que las de Time Warner caan un 0 5 por ciento

title: BORSA MILANO chiude calo con Europa  rimbalza Leonardo  male Ferragamo
text: MILANO  15 novembre  Reuters    Piazza Affari chiude ribasso sopra minimi  facendo un po  peggio del resto d Europa  un mercato influenzato dal rafforzamento dell euro e dalla debolezza dei corsi delle commodity   L indice FTSE Mib ha chiuso calo dello 0 62  l ALL Share dello 0 7  con volumi di scambi complessivi per 3 miliardi di euro  Il benchmark europeo Stoxx 600 perde lo 0 4  Anche Wall Street  ribasso  influenzata anche dal calo del greggio    Maglia nera del listino principale  FERRAGAMO   che  dopo risultati del terzo trimestre che hanno indotto gli analisti rivedere al ribasso le stime sul 2017 e sul 2018  chiude calo del 4 08    Realizzi su CAMPARI   che perde il 3 11  dopo il rialzo di ieri sull annuncio dell ingresso del titolo nell indice Msci Global    Male anche petroliferi  con SAIPEM che cede l 1 7  cos come SNAM   ed ENI  1 84  un settore europeo ribasso dell 1 33    Recupera il calo della mattinata l indice settoriale italiano dei bancari   che si attesta  0 45  Inverte la rotta e chiude rialzo del 2 4  anche BANCO BPM   dopo la fissazione del prezzo di esercizio della put di UnipolSai  1 4  sulla quota del 50  detenuta nella JV di bancassurance Popolare Vita per 535 5 milioni  Bene anche BPER  2 11  e UBI BANCA  1 04    Restano pesanti invece CARIGE   che chiude  11 10  e CREVAL  6 15    Anche MPS perde il 4 9  dopo aver segnato il nuovo minimo  Secondo il suo presidente Alessandro Falciai  movimenti del titolo sono dovuti situazioni macroeconomiche europee e non specifiche della banca    ATLANTIA perde l 1 28  Oggi l AD Giovanni Castellucci un intervista al Financial Times ha detto che la societ  pronta rendere la sua offerta su Abertis  adeguatamente competitiva  al momento giusto    In ripresa LEONARDO  4 46  che ha perso il 29  tre giorni per effetto del profit warning  Considerato che lo scenario peggiore  gi incorporato nei prezzi  Equita Sim ha rivisto il titolo  buy  proprio sulla debolezza    Bene anche TELECOM ITALIA  1 72  che interrompe la fase di ribassi  Secondo un broker la nomina di Elisabetta Ripa come AD di Open Fiber  societ che fa capo Enel e Cdp  riaccende speculazioni su un accordo sulla rete    DE  LONGHI calo del 13  24 euro risente del collocamento del 5  del capitale da parte delle controllante DL Industrial 25 euro per azione    ASTALDI chiude calo del 32 39  affossata dai deboli risultati del terzo trimestre e dall annuncio di un piano di rafforzamento patrimoniale complessivo da 400 milioni di euro    Ancora sul fronte delle trimestrali corre EL EN  5 8  spinta dai risultati del terzo trimestre migliori delle attese e dal miglioramento della guidance per il 2017    Sul fronte media  IL SOLE 24 ORE perde il 26 12  alla vigilia del termine dell aumento di capitale  Male anche CAIRO COMMUNICATION  4 41  di cui stamani Kepler Cheuvreux ha tagliato il target price 5 60 euro da 6 10  Bene invece RCS   che dopo il calo di ieri chiude rialzo del 6 72  Per una wants prevent similarly draconian actions taking place  Unions adapt new media reality The newspaper industry unions long history  One earliest unions formed newsroom American Newspaper Guild  founded 1933  The guild  now renamed NewsGuild  evolved represent 24 000 employees performing variety jobs  reporters editors graphic designers  However  past several decades  rapid technological change growing competition readers advertisers strained labor management relations industry  Between 1960 1965  example  108 strikes took place newspaper industry  The 1990s witnessed another wave high title: The two obstacles holding back Alzheimer s research
text: The Conversation independent nonprofit source news  analysis commentary academic experts  Todd Golde  University Florida  THE CONVERSATION  Thirty years ago  scientists began unlock mysteries regarding cause Alzheimer s disease  This knowledge ushered era great enthusiasm scientists could develop new therapies either prevent Alzheimer s significantly slow symptoms present  Despite continued progress renewed hope therapies human trials modify course disease  initial optimism neuroscientists like significantly tempered reality  Numerous therapies  sound scientific basis  tested shown ineffective humans symptomatic Alzheimer s disease  Like war cancer  war Alzheimer s disease going single glorious  battle  Instead  I believe incremental yet transformative progress eventually lead success  Unlike cancer  scientific community yet  survivor stories  buoy efforts  take concerted effort scientists  pharmaceutical companies  government society bring reality ending Alzheimer s disease  Only recognizing confronting obstacles impeding development Alzheimer s therapies confident battle successful  As physician scientist director University Florida s McKnight Brain Institute began studying Alzheimer s disease medical school late 1980s  I appreciate scope scientific advances collectively made  I also come sobering realization translating advances real therapies make difference patients suffering devastating disease incredibly complex issue science  There two significant  nonscientific obstacles   shortage funding patent law   require concerted effort scientists  concerned citizens  society lawmakers overcome  Funding improving  still lagging Governments industrialized nations recognized research funding Alzheimer s disease related dementias insufficient  This lack funding drawing wider notice  Indeed  Bill Gates recently made public recognition need funding pledged US 50 million Alzheimer s research  Just within U S  National Institute Health funding increased past five years  503 million per year  1 391 billion per year  increase additional  400 million proposed 2018  To many  even  500 million per year may sound like lot funds  given current costs U S  society  200 250 billion per year Alzheimer s  money spent research drop bucket  Furthermore  compared funding cancer  about  6 billion per year NIH  I believe additional funding appropriate necessary  Due increasing number Americans living longer lives  Alzheimer s advocacy groups others estimate number individuals suffering dementia may almost triple  5 million 13 5 million  We right track  spend  6 billion per year cancer  may need spend much dementia make difference  Prevention important unrealized goal One challenges treating disease brain riddled pathology time person shows symptoms Alzheimer s  Many research efforts therefore looking prevention  We know pathologies driving disease   protein deposits called amyloid plaques neurofibrillay tangles   appear 20 years overt symptoms dementia appear  These gradually accumulate sequentially brain  amyloid preceding abnormal tangle pathology  tangle pathology seemingly tightly linked cognitive decline  Thus  prevent deposits small molecule drugs  antibodies even gene therapies  might prevent Alzheimer s disease  A number studies underway  preventative therapies exist  Though lifestyle interventions exercise  memory enhancing  mind games also investigated possible ways stave slow cognitive decline  evidence actually alter underlying pathology little evidence slow disease course  I seen many people lived healthiest lifestyle stayed intellectually socially active throughout lives  yet still developed Alzheimer s  They testament need therapies actually alter pathobiological process underlying disease  A surprise impediment  Patent law A major  largely unspoken block testing developing best therapies prevention current patent law  Costs running defintitive clinical trials necessary test even symptomatic therapy exceed  1 billion  costs prevention trials far exceed figure  Prevention trials likely take five 10     years yield answer whether drug intervention working  Patent protection market exclusivity may already expired time drug approved years remaining  This severely limits ability pharmaceutical sector invest Alzheimer s prevention studies  They cannot justify cost business point view  This presents huge dilemma  Researchers  hope help  need private sector investment  private sector clear financial incentive conduct studies  Scientists pharmaceutical companies simply cannot make business case risking billions dollars develop test Alzheimer s prevention therapy may may work  would approved use patent protecting therapy expired  The company would never able recoup development costs

title: Trump s opioid declaration meaningless without treatment dollars
text: President Donald Trump s recent declaration public health emergency opioid epidemic mostly meaningless without dollars treatment  President Donald Trump recently declared public health emergency according national researchfunded federal government  Prescription opioid drug deaths quadrupled nationally since 1999  according Centers Disease Control Prevention  More 100 people die every day First  grants used set drug treatment centers across state  rural urban areas  limited scope  Washington state given  12 million federal dollars bipartisan Cures Act adopted Congress nearly year ago  expectation grants would last year  The Cures Act included  1 billion opioid treatment  aimed reaching underserved populations  particularly rural areas  If Trump administration wants make difference fighting opioid epidemic  continue make treatment money available throw away cash ineffective TV campaigns

title: Venezuela defaulted  moving deeper crisis
text: Venezuela  nation spiraling humanitarian crisis  missed debt payment  It could soon face grim consequences  The South American country defaulted debt  according statement issued Monday night S P Global Ratings  The agency said 30 day grace period expired payment due October  A debt default risks setting dangerous series events could exacerbate Venezuela s food medical shortages  If enough holders particular bond demand full immediate repayment  prompt investors across Venezuelan bonds demand thing  Since Venezuela doesn t money pay bondholders right now  investors would entitled seize country s assets   primarily barrels oil   outside borders  Related  Trump administration bars U S  banks Venezuelan debt Venezuela meaningful income oil sells abroad  The government  meanwhile  failed years ship enough food medicine citizens  As result  Venezuelans waiting hours line buy food dying hospitals lack basic resources  If investors seize country s oil shipments  food medical shortages would worsen quickly   Then it s pandemonium  says Fernando Freijedo  analyst Economist Intelligence Unit  research firm   The humanitarian crisis already pretty dire   boggles mind could happen next  It s immediately clear steps bondholders take  Argentina went vaguely similar default  bondholders battled government 15 years settling 2016  Every case different  though  Related  Venezuela admits can t pay debts anymore Venezuela state run oil company  PDVSA  owe  60 billion bondholders  In total  country owes far more   196 billion  according paper published Harvard Law Roundtable authored lawyers Mark Walker Richard Cooper  Beyond bond payments  Venezuela owes money China  Russia  oil service providers  U S  airlines many entities  The nation s central bank  9 6 billion reserves slowly drained bank account years make payments  The S P default announcement Monday came Venezuelan government officials met bondholders Caracas  The meeting reportedly brief offered clarity government plans restructure debt  The Venezuelan government blames debt woes   inability pay   longstanding  economic war  waged U S  More recently  Trump administration slapped financial sanctions Venezuela PDVSA  barring banks U S  trading investing newly issued Venezuelan debt  But experts say socialist Venezuelan regime power since 1999 bears brunt blame  It fixed   froze   prices everything cup coffee tank gas effort make goods affordable masses  For years  Venezuelan leaders also fixed exchange rate currency  bolivar  Related  Venezuela blaming Trump missed debt payments Those moves among driving forces behind food shortages  Farmers couldn t sell low prices without going business cost production much higher  Importers also couldn t afford ship food  knowing would sell much lower prices paid port  When food shortages grew worse  illegal black market emerged venders sold basic foods vastly higher prices government s artificially low prices  Inflation soared  making bolivar almost worthless  One U S  dollar currently buys 55 200 bolivars  At beginning year  dollar worth 3 200 bolivars  according dolartoday com  website tracks unofficial rate millions patients cured  83 others receiving treatment  The number hospitalizations plague also decreased  according World Health Organization  Although number total cases continued increase   enhanced surveillance ongoing investigations  WHO said  cases actually infected  upon inspection  The epidemic remains active 12 districts  among total cases reported  61  said pneumonic plague  according UN title: A four day workweek could hazardous health
text: Many employers employees love thought four day workweek   Supposedly  four day work schedule allows workers extra time pursue leisure activities family togetherness  Spurred visions spending time beach  many people encouraging businesses adopt kind work plan  There many purported advantages   Some authorities say four day work schedule facilitates ability provide child care assistance elderly  Proponents  compressed  work schedules   employees work longer hours fewer days week   point gains productivity result decreased overhead costs   keep lights nobody working  Additional cost savings obtained reducing total weekly commuting time A variety business tested four day concept  including Amazon  Google  Deloitte host smaller firms  Amazon announced late August experimenting even shorter workweek 30 hours select employees  would earn 75 percent full time salary  choose opt in  Many pilot programs shown promising results  Statistics Society Human Resource Management indicate 31 percent employees compressed workweek schedule 2015  That s case  however  5 percent large companies  This issue I considerable experience  I studying health effects long working hours nearly 30 years  All studies point potential dangers occur result additional risks created work demands exceed particular threshold  Most studies I performed suggest dangers pronounced people regularly work 12 hours per day 60 hours per week  It sounded like good idea The idea four day workweek new  Labor experts studying advocating approaches since 1970s  For example  2008  researchers Brigham Young University conducted series surveys among employees community members assess perspectives four day workweek  The researchers found four fifths employees reported positive experience working type schedule  Based positive results  Utah s governor enacted mandatory four day workweek state employees  The state s goal curb energy costs  improve air quality  ensure needed services would still available  for instance  garbage collection  help recruit retain state employees  In 2011  however  Utah reversed course  saying savings never materialized  Other research also supported development adoption compressed work schedules  A 1989 study found compressed schedules  PDF  related high levels job satisfaction employees  satisfaction work schedules  supervisors also reported pleased four day workweek schedules  Are hidden dangers  Despite widespread enthusiasm four day week  I convinced kind schedule beneficial employees businesses  The primary problem idea whatever work needs done  needs get done amount total time  Despite wishes contrary  still 24 hours day  The math simple  working five eight hour shifts equivalent working four 10 hour shifts  That s true  But implications schedules different  The danger disregarding health effects occur result fatigue stress accumulate longer than normal working day  I performed study showing risk suffering industrial accident raised 37 percent employees working 12 hours day  The risk 61 percent higher people  overtime  shifts  Working 60 hours week related additional injury risk 23 percent  As hours worked schedules increase  risks grow accordingly  More recently  Dr  Xiaoxi Yao  colleague mine Mayo Clinic  I recently performed another study using 32 years work hour information analyze relationship long working hours many years risk diagnosed chronic disease later life  We found dangers quite substantial   especially women  Women working 60 hours per week  equivalent 12 hours per day  three times likely eventually suffer heart disease  cancer  arthritis diabetes  twice likely chronic lung disease asthma  women working conventional 40 hour workweek  Working bit more  average 41 50 hours per week  many years appeared substantially increase long term risk disease  These studies show hours created equal  The research suggests harm may occur past certain point   A four day week causes workers squeeze hours usual day  For workers already prone overwork  additional burden compressing five days four could literally break camel s   worker s   back  Is stress worth it  Besides health issues  employers workers also need consider effect compressing hours four day period workers  mental health  stress levels fatigue  Occupational psychologists realize people function effectively tired stressed  This may even concern older persons  Moreover  squeezing five days 10 hour a day work compressed 40 hour schedule create rigidity reduced flexibility families children  For example  two additional work hours per day added onto conventional day schedule begins morning approximately 8 9 a m  extends late afternoon hours 4 5 p m  many working parents lose ability interact children  prime time  5 7 p m  kids otherwise would likely house potentially available socialize siblings parents   bedtime arrives  There many obvious ways address concerns make life easier workers families  Don t overwork  Don t stay long work  Find job employer flexible working hours  Join conversation See latest news share comments CNN Health Facebook Twitter  I don t know you  prospect four day week scares me  I already hard enough time getting regular weekly work done five days  And it s always tempting glance work email   couple notes jot down  Instead  pull back certain point  Maybe it s time take Friday every often  How ending work noon Fridays  practice many Jews  bring weekend gradual way  The trade off  necessary  would involve adding small increase one hour per day normal Monday Friday schedule  That approach actually personal favorite  My friend Lonnie Golden  professor Pennsylvania State University   Abington  advocates adopting  Goldilocks  workweek  one long  short satisfies employer s interest productivity employee s interest attaining good health well being

title: Tanker becomes first cross Arctic without icebreaker
text: Climate change helping create new opportunities shipping companies melting ice around North Pole  A Russian tanker carrying natural gas become first merchant ship sail across Arctic without help icebreaker  finishing journey record time  The ship  Christophe de Margerie  traveled Norway South Korea 19 days  30  quicker regular route Suez Canal  Russian owner  Sovcomflot  said week  Related  Businesses benefit global warming The tanker managed complete northernmost part voyage two remote Russian ports   known Northern Sea Route   record breaking six and half days  Every year  arctic ice naturally shrinks spring summer growing winter  But global temperatures risen  old sea ice lasts year year shrunk smallest level three decades  Thinner  younger sea ice   less year old   become majority across Arctic  Young ice struggles reach thickness 2 meters  6 feet  winter months likely melt summer  Related  Watch old sea ice vanishes It s huge concern  According NASA  many global climate models predict Arctic ice free least part year end 21st century  Some models predict ice free Arctic midcentury  That would direct impact weather patterns around world  The thinning ice also opens new paths global trade  saving companies hundreds thousands dollars would spend longer journeys via southerly routes   This paradox climate change  said Ben Ayliffe  campaigner Greenpeace   The fossil fuels we re burning allowing access areas previously protected ice  He expressed concern increasing sea traffic inhospitable environment bring new risks  fuel spill would virtually impossible clean up  Shipping tankers making way across top world typically need accompanied massive  nuclear powered Russian icebreakers plow patches six foot thick ice  But Christophe de Margerie  named former CEO French oil giant Total  specially designed sail independently ice thick 2 1 meters  nearly 7 feet  owner said  That means able operate harsh Arctic waters year round rather summer months  Its recent journey ferrying liquified natural gas 2 000 nautical miles ice thick 1 2 meters  4 feet   demonstrates economic potential using Northern Sea Route large capacity vessel transits  Sovcomflot said

title: Republicans Slap Expiration Date Middle Class Tax Cuts
text: The new Senate plan would cuts individuals go away eight years make permanent corporations  Updated November 15 4 13 p m  ET President Trump congressional Republicans repeatedly insisted top priority tax reform delivering relief middle class  But significant change Senate s plan announced late Tuesday night  relief people temporary  millions middle class families could actually see tax increase 2026 Congress doesn t act again  As I recently reported  competing Republican tax bills over budget  forcing party leaders scale back hoped pass legislation Senate rules without Democratic votes  They essentially two choices  They could slap expiration date proposal s large corporate tax cut from 35 percent 20 percent or could sunset provisions benefitting individuals  For now  Republicans siding businesses  keeping lower corporate rate permanent setting nearly individual tax cuts expire eight years  end 2025  The decision nod conservative economists argue permanence business tax rates key producing desired growth GDP  companies likely plan expansion investments years ahead time  And it s also bet future Congresses whether Democratic Republican majorities will extend cuts individuals stave politically unpopular tax increase  Related Stories The GOP s High Risk Move Whack Obamacare Its Tax Bill The Republican Tax Bills Are About Shrink Yet choice dents GOP s message bill targeted chiefly middle class families big business   Bottom line  colleagues side shown hand  said Senator Ron Wyden Oregon  top Democrat Finance Committee  wrote bill held combative want reconcile legislation send Trump s desk Christmas  Adding GOP s hurry Senate special election next month Alabama  If Democrat Doug Jones defeats scandal plagued Roy Moore  Republican majority In short term  middle class families better revised Senate bill original  Hatch slightly lowered individual income rates increased child tax credit  2 000   The credit currently  1 000 per child  first Senate draft would bumped  1 650  But like rest individual provisions  including repeal alternative minimum tax doubling estate tax exemption  perks would go away eight years   We make They would need 60 votes  including least eight Democrats  get around that   We make individual side permanent  Senator John Thune South Dakota said   All takes Democrats help us that  Democrats  course  mood assist Republicans passing bill consider fiscally irresponsible skewed toward rich  They spent much Wednesday s hearing hammering GOP inserting repeal Affordable Care Act s individual mandate bill  move helped offset tax cuts budget  While Republicans argued eliminating penalty hits lower income Americans disproportionately  Democrats countered scrapping penalty would actually title: Republicans Slap Expiration Date Middle Class Tax Cuts
text: The new Senate plan would cuts individuals go away eight years make permanent corporations  Updated November 15 4 13 p m  ET President Trump congressional Republicans repeatedly insisted top priority tax reform delivering relief middle class  But significant change Senate s plan announced late Tuesday night  relief people temporary  millions middle class families could actually see tax increase 2026 Congress doesn t act again  As I recently reported  competing Republican tax bills over budget  forcing party leaders scale back hoped pass legislation Senate rules without Democratic votes  They essentially two choices  They could slap expiration date proposal s large corporate tax cut from 35 percent 20 percent or could sunset provisions benefitting individuals  For now  Republicans siding businesses  keeping lower corporate rate permanent setting nearly individual tax cuts expire eight years  end 2025  The decision nod conservative economists argue permanence business tax rates key producing desired growth GDP  companies likely plan expansion investments years ahead time  And it s also bet future Congresses whether Democratic Republican majorities will extend cuts individuals stave politically unpopular tax increase  Related Stories The GOP s High Risk Move Whack Obamacare Its Tax Bill The Republican Tax Bills Are About Shrink Yet choice dents GOP s message bill targeted chiefly middle class families big business   Bottom line  colleagues side shown hand  said Senator Ron Wyden Oregon  top Democrat Finance Committee  wrote bill held combative markup revised proposal Wednesday less 12 hours changes unveiled  Republicans panel hope approve bill week full Senate vote Thanksgiving  The House set pass version tax bill Thursday  party leaders want reconcile legislation send Trump s desk Christmas  Adding GOP s hurry Senate special election next month Alabama  If Democrat Doug Jones defeats scandal plagued Roy Moore  Republican majority come January would single seat  Wyden said changes ordered Chairman Orrin Hatch Utah created  double standard  handouts corporations  etched stone  relief families would go away  And Republicans making permanent changes way inflation calculated tax policy  many people would see net tax increase pay today personal tax cuts expire   For middle class families  deal looks worse worse  Wyden said  In short term  middle class families better revised Senate bill original  Hatch slightly lowered individual income rates increased child tax credit  2 000   The credit currently  1 000 per child  first Senate draft would bumped  1 650  But like rest individual provisions  including repeal alternative minimum tax doubling estate tax exemption  perks would go away eight years   We make individual side permanent  All takes Democrats help us that  Republicans readily acknowledged sunset personal tax cuts abide Senate budget rules  forbid tax legislation adding deficit first decade  They would need 60 votes  including least eight Democrats  get around that   We make individual side permanent  Senator John Thune South Dakota said   All takes Democrats help us that  Democrats  course  mood assist Republicans passing bill consider fiscally irresponsible skewed toward rich  They spent much Wednesday s hearing hammering GOP inserting repeal Affordable Care Act s individual mandate bill  move helped offset tax cuts budget  While Republicans argued eliminating penalty hits lower income Americans disproportionately  Democrats countered scrapping penalty would actually raise costs people higher insurance premiums a view shared nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office   You spending  338 billion make tax cuts corporations permanent  Democratic Senator Claire McCaskill
